item.title: VIEW 美国8月非农就业不及预期，推动更大幅度降息观点
item.description: 故事：美国 8 月份就业人数增幅低于预期，但失业率降至 4.2%，表明劳动力市场继续有序放缓，美联储本月可能不会大幅降息。【原文：STORY: U.S. employment increased less than expected in August, but a drop in the jobless rate to 4.2% suggested an orderly labor market slowdown continued and probably did not warrant a big interest rate cut from the Federal Reserve this month.】

item.title: 对经济增长的担忧导致美国股票基金大量流出
item.description: 截至 9 月 4 日，美国股票基金经历了 12 周以来最大的单周资金外流，原因是投资者在等待关键的劳动力市场数据时对经济前景的焦虑加剧。【原文：U.S. equity funds experienced their largest weekly outflow in 12 weeks by Sept. 4, driven by heightened investor anxiety about the economic outlook as they awaited crucial labor market data.】

item.title: 美联储威廉姆斯称开始降息的时机已到
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行行长约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）周五表示，较好的经济平衡为降息敞开了大门，但全部行动将由经济表现来决定。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of New York President John Williams said Friday that a better balanced economy has opened the door to cutting rates, with the full course of action to be determined by how the economy performs.】

item.title: 消息人士称，DSV 在竞购德国铁路申克公司的过程中遥遥领先
item.description: 几位熟悉销售过程的人士周五告诉路透社，丹麦运输公司 DSV 在竞购德国国营铁路德铁的物流部门全球国际货运（Schenker）的竞争中略胜一筹。【原文：Danish transport firm DSV is slightly ahead in the bidding race for German state railway Deutsche Bahn's logistics unit Schenker, several people familiar with the sales process told Reuters on Friday.】

item.title: 随着美国就业增长降温，美联储将大幅降息
item.description: 一份政府报告显示，8 月份失业率降至 4.2%，但 8 月和 7 月雇主增加的工人数量均低于经济学家的预期，交易商认为美联储本月将开始一轮降息，降息幅度将扩大 50 个基点。 交易员目前认为，美联储有 55% 的可能性将其政策利率从目前的 5.25%-5.50% 下调至 4.75%。【原文：Traders see the Federal Reserve starting a round of interest rates cuts this month with an upsized 50 basis point reduction, after a government report showed the unemployment rate eased to 4.2% in August but employers added fewer workers than economists had expected in both August and July. Traders now see a 55% chance that the Fed will cut its policy rate, now in the 5.25%-5.50% range, to a 4.75%】

item.title: 美国 8 月份就业增长不及预期
item.description: 美国 8 月份就业人数增幅低于预期，但失业率降至 4.2%，表明劳动力市场继续有序放缓，美联储本月可能无需大幅降息。【原文：U.S. employment increased less than expected in August, but a drop in the jobless rate to 4.2% suggested an orderly labor market slowdown continued and probably did not warrant a big interest rate cut from the Federal Reserve this month.】

item.title: 财政部称，美国国税局执法工作追回了 13 亿美元的未缴税款
item.description: 美国财政部和国税局周五表示，根据新的执法计划，他们已从富人手中追回了 13 亿美元的未缴税款，这些资金来自以气候为重点的《减少通货膨胀法案》（Inflation Reduction Act）中的 600 亿美元国税局现代化开支。【原文：The U.S. Treasury and Internal Revenue Service said on Friday that they have recovered $1.3 billion in unpaid taxes from wealthy individuals under new enforcement initiatives funded by $60 billion in IRS modernization spending from the climate-focused Inflation Reduction Act.】

item.title: 增长忧虑导致全球股票基金资金外流；就业数据拭目以待
item.description: 在截至 9 月 4 日的一周内，全球股票基金出现了四周以来的首次单周资金外流，原因是谨慎的投资者因担心全球经济增长而撤资，而且本周的美国就业报告也将是重磅数据。【原文：Global equity funds experienced their first weekly outflow in four weeks in the week to September 4, as cautious investors pulled back on concerns about global economic growth and ahead of a data-heavy week culminating in the U.S. jobs report.】

item.title: 电动汽车需求放缓，汽车制造商调整电气化计划
item.description: 据报道，日本丰田汽车公司已将其2026年的电动汽车生产计划削减了三分之一，这是在需求放缓的情况下，最新一家削减电动汽车计划的汽车制造商。【原文：Japan's Toyota Motor has reportedly slashed its electric vehicle production plans for 2026 by a third, the latest automaker to roll back EV plans amid slowing demand.】

item.title: 意大利转向越南和墨西哥出口汽车零部件，以应对德国的疲软
item.description: 意大利一位部长表示，由于预计德国在大众汽车危机中需求疲软，意大利正在寻求墨西哥和越南作为其汽车零部件生产的替代出口市场。【原文：Italy is looking to Mexico and Vietnam as it seeks alternative export markets for its production of automotive components, in anticipation of weaker demand from Germany amid the Volkswagen crisis, an Italian minister said.】

item.title: 加拿大皇家银行美国全球资产管理主管看好新兴市场和另类资产的发展前景
item.description: 加拿大皇家银行（Royal Bank of Canada）新任首席执行官唐纳德-桑亚（Donald Sanya）表示，该行将加大对另类投资、新兴市场债务和股票的投资力度，以促进其美国全球资产管理业务的发展。【原文：Royal Bank of Canada is betting on alternative investments and emerging markets debt and equity to boost its U.S. global asset management business, said new CEO Donald Sanya, who aims to ramp up hiring.】

item.title: 博通股价暴跌，营收目标令希望人工智能大幅提振的投资者失望
item.description: 博通公司（Broadcom）的股价在周五的盘前交易中下滑了约 9%，此前这家芯片制造商的营收预期吓到了押注人工智能芯片的强劲需求将推动其强劲增长的投资者。【原文：Broadcom's shares slid about 9% in premarket trading on Friday, after the chipmaker's revenue forecast spooked investors betting on robust demand for AI chips to drive strong growth.】

item.title: 报告称英国经济增长需要额外 1.3 万亿美元投资
item.description: 周五的一份报告称，英国需要在未来十年追加一万亿英镑（1.3 万亿美元）的投资，以实现经济增长。【原文：Britain needs an additional one trillion pounds ($1.3 trillion) in investment in the next decade to grow the economy, a report said on Friday.】

item.title: 巴菲特的伯克希尔公司再次抛售美国银行股票，总销售额接近 70 亿美元
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）再次削减了其在美国银行的股份，使自 7 月中旬以来的出售总额接近 70 亿美元。【原文：Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has trimmed its stake in Bank of America once again, making the total sales since mid-July nearly $7 billion.】

item.title: 大众工厂威胁考验德国经济模式
item.description: 失去了来自俄罗斯的廉价能源，与中国曾经有利可图的贸易关系又面临着不确定性，德国大企业现在正面临着其长期成功公式中第三个要素--协商一致的劳资关系--的紧要关头。【原文：Having lost cheap energy from Russia and facing uncertainty over its once-lucrative trade ties with China, big German business is now facing a crunch point over a third ingredient in its long-time formula for success - consensual industrial relations.】

item.title: 投资者为薪资数据做好准备，期货下跌
item.description: 美国股指期货周五下跌，此前将公布关键的就业数据，这些数据可能对美联储本月晚些时候决定降息幅度起到关键作用。【原文：U.S. stock index futures fell on Friday ahead of key jobs data that could be pivotal when the Federal Reserve decides on the size of its interest rate cut that is expected later this month.】

item.title: 早间竞标薪资、威廉姆斯和沃勒尔--重要的决定性因素
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 特朗普为马斯克领导的效率委员会制定的计划可能会让首席执行官对其工作和财富的规则施加影响
item.description: 亿万富翁埃隆-马斯克将领导一个职责广泛的政府效率委员会，如果 唐纳德-特朗普 当选美国总统，他有可能改变美国企业的规则，包括他的公司参与竞争的众多行业。【原文：Billionaire Elon Musk will head a government efficiency commission with a vast remit if Donald Trump is elected U.S. president, potentially putting him in position to change the rules for corporate America, including the wide swath of industries in which his companies compete.】

item.title: 空客交付量下降，赢得私人客户大笔订单
item.description: 欧洲飞机制造商空中客车公司周五表示，8月份的交付量在前一个月大幅飙升后出现下降，分析人士称，这一下降使该公司不得不实现稳健的同比增长，以达到年度目标。【原文：Airbus deliveries fell in August after a sharp spike in the previous month, the European planemaker said on Friday, a decline which analysts said leaves it with the task of achieving solid year-on-year growth to meet an annual target.】

item.title: 星际娱乐公司将以 450 万美元出售赌场大楼的租赁权益
item.description: Star Entertainment 公司周五表示，该公司将以 6750 万澳元（4550 万美元）的价格出售其在昆士兰州的 Treasury Brisbane 赌场大楼中的租赁权益。【原文：Star Entertainment said on Friday its unit will sell its leasehold interest in the Treasury Brisbane Casino building in Queensland for A$67.5 million ($45.5 million).】

item.title: 英国监管机构反对谷歌的广告技术行为
item.description: 英国竞争监督机构周五表示，暂时认定谷歌通过其发布商广告服务器和购买工具的运营滥用其支配地位，限制了英国的竞争。【原文：Britain's competition watchdog said on Friday it provisionally found Google had abused its dominant positions through the operation of both its publisher ad server and buying tools to restrict competition in the UK.】

item.title: 日本航空公司预计 A350 检查不会导致航班取消
item.description: 日本航空公司周五表示，预计不会因欧洲航空安全监管机构下令对空客A350-1000喷气机发动机进行检查而导致航班取消或延误。【原文：Japan Airlines does not expect flight cancellations or delays as a result of inspections ordered by Europe's air safety regulator on engines of Airbus A350-1000 jets, it said on Friday.】

item.title: 巴基斯坦比亚迪称，到 2030 年电动汽车将占汽车销量的一半以上
item.description: 中国比亚迪与巴基斯坦汽车集团 Mega Motors 合作成立的比亚迪巴基斯坦公司表示，到 2030 年，巴基斯坦购买的所有汽车中将有多达 50%实现某种形式的电气化，与全球目标保持一致。【原文：Up to 50% of all vehicles bought in Pakistan by 2030 will be electrified in some form in line with global targets, BYD Pakistan, a partnership between China's BYD and Pakistani car group Mega Motors, said.】

item.title: 美国银行称，美联储降息前投资者继续抢购现金
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America）周五表示，在截至本周三的一周内，投资者向类似现金的货币市场基金投入了610亿美元，因为他们在为美联储四年来首次降息做准备。【原文：Investors poured $61 billion into cash-like money market funds in the week to Wednesday, as they braced for the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates for the first time in four years, Bank of America said on Friday.】

item.title: 中国必胜客新概念店帮助节俭的食客节省开支
item.description: 快餐巨头必胜客为适应中国疲软的经济形势，正在开设门店，提供更小更便宜的必胜客最受欢迎的菜品，以吸引注重成本的食客，其母公司百胜中国也在为其他品牌采取这一策略。【原文：Fast food giant Pizza Hut is adapting to China's sluggish economy by opening stores that offer smaller, cheaper versions of its favourites to attract cost-conscious diners, a strategy its parent Yum China is also using for other brands.】

item.title: 奥地利 Raiffeisen 银行与俄罗斯的纠葛时间表
item.description: 俄罗斯法院冻结了 Raiffeisen Bank International 在当地的分支机构，暂时扼杀了出售该业务的任何前景，并加深了莫斯科与西方之间的对峙。【原文：A Russian court has frozen Raiffeisen Bank International's local arm, killing off any prospect of selling the business for now and deepening the standoff between Moscow and the West.】

item.title: 大众汽车德国电池厂在成本压力下将保持半数产能
item.description: 大众汽车公司的电池子公司 PowerCo 将在其位于德国的萨尔茨吉特（Salzgitter）工厂建造两条计划中的生产线中的一条，该公司的工作委员会表示，由于该行业正在适应电动汽车需求的放缓，目前将只建造一条生产线。【原文：Volkswagen's PowerCo battery subsidiary will build just one of two planned production lines at its Salzgitter plant in Germany for now, its works council said, as the sector adjusts to slowing demand for electric vehicles.】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称，尽管投资者反对，印度仍将收紧衍生品规则
item.description: 四位直接了解此事的消息人士称，印度市场监管机构将收紧衍生品规则，增加准入门槛，并提高交易成本，以限制散户投资者投机高风险合约。【原文：India's markets regulator will tighten derivative rules to increase entry barriers and make it more expensive to trade as it tries to limit retail investors speculating on risky contracts, said four sources with direct knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 据《日经新闻》报道，丰田将把 2026 年的全球电动汽车产量削减约三分之一，降至 100 万辆
item.description: 据《日经商业日报》周五报道，丰田汽车将把 2026 年的全球电动汽车产量从之前宣布的 150 万辆销售计划削减至约 100 万辆。【原文：Toyota Motor will cut its 2026 global EV production to around 1 million vehicles, down from a previously announced sales plan of 1.5 million, the Nikkei business daily reported on Friday.】

item.title: X 全球事务主管尼克-皮克斯辞职
item.description: X 的全球事务主管尼克-皮克斯（Nick Pickles）周四表示，在这家社交媒体公司（前身为 Twitter）工作十年后，他将辞职。【原文：X's global affairs head Nick Pickles said on Thursday he is quitting after a decade with the social media company formerly called Twitter.】
